page.title: 10SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: The Blackbirds' Farm Sewage Works were opened on July 20th 1973. It is run by The Thames Valley Water Authority and deals with all the sewage for {RADLETT, ST ALBANS, HATFIELD, ELSTREE} and {POTTERS BAR.} The daily intake of sewage is 27,000 to 30,000 cubic metres. There are 3 massive treatment pans; a central Control Room of a modern design and this is staff operated. All the treated sewage is returned to The River Colne as clean water. The River Colne lies half a mile to the West and North of the site. The choice of site was carefully selected and it lies at the bottom of a dry valley, well out of view and is not in fact seen until you are nearly on top of it.
